g.text: 136. Markowicz, K. M. & Witek, M. L. Simulations of contrail optical properties
and radiative forcing for various crystal shapes.
137. Schumann, U. et al. Effective radius of ice particles in cirrus and contrails.
138. Forster, P. M. Inference of climate sensitivity from analysis of Earth
139. Holmes, C. D., Tang, Q. & Prather, M. J. Uncertainties in climate assessment
for the case of aviation NO.
140. Wilcox, L. J., Shine, K. P. & Hoskins, B. J. Radiative forcing due to aviation
141. Yang, P. et al. Scattering and absorption property database for nonspherical
ice particles in the near-through far-infrared spectral region.
142. Spangenberg, D. A., Bedka, S. T., Palikonda, R., Duda, D. P. & Rose, F. G.
Contrail radiative forcing over the Northern Hemisphere from 2006 Aqua
143. Irvine, E. A., Hoskins, B. J. & Shine, K. P. A Lagrangian analysis of ice-
supersaturated air over the North Atlantic.
144. Gierens, K. & Spichtinger, P. On the size distribution of ice- supersaturated
regions in the upper troposphere and lowermost stratosphere.
145. Spichtinger, P., Gierens, K., Leiterer, U. & Dier, H. Ice supersaturation in the
146. Rädel, G. & Shine, K. Evaluation of the use of radiosonde humidity data to
predict the occurrence of persistent contrails.
147. Baughum, S. L., Danilin, M. Y., Miloshevich, L. M. & Heyms
Properties of ice-supersaturated layers based on radiosonde data analysis. In
This work was conceived while the author stayed at the National Atmospheric and
s (NOAA) Earth System Research Laboratory (ESRL) as a
Cooperative Institute for Research in Environmental Sciences (CIRES) sabbatical visiting
fellow. I wish to express gratitude to Chuck Brock, Dave Fahey, Graham Feingold, Piers
Forster, Franziska Glaßmeier and Axel Lauer for their critical reading of and detailed
comments on manuscript drafts, and to Steven Baughcum, Paul DeMott, Andrew Get-
telman, Volker Grewe, Carolin Klinger, Thomas Koop, Eric Jensen, Chuck Long, Rick
Miake-Lye, Pat Minnis, Rich Moore, Roberto Paoli, Michael Ponater, Mattia Righi,
Simon Unterstraßer and Xavier Vancassel for giving me valuable feedback on speci
topics. I would especially like to thank Ann Reiser and Annie Davis for editorial assis-
tance and work on the visuals. I am deeply grateful to my hosts at ESRL, Dave Fahey and
Graham Feingold, for their hospitality and insights that continue to catalyse my work.
B. K. conceived the review, collected and interpreted data, and wrote the paper.
The authors declare no competing interests.
